---



---


The `+++` markers are TOML front matter delimiters used by Hugo. They mark metadata (title, date, author, categories, etc.) that Hugo needs to build the site.

The front matter cannot be removed, but you can switch to YAML format (`---` instead of `+++`). Checking how many articles use TOML vs YAML:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="search" data-tool-name="grep">
<details>
<summary>Tool use: **grep** • Grep for "^\+{3}$" in "content/posts" • 0 matches</summary>

Output mode: count



</details>
</tool-use>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="search" data-tool-name="grep">
<details>
<summary>Tool use: **grep** • Grep for "^---$" in "content/posts" • 0 matches</summary>

Output mode: count



</details>
</tool-use>

---



---


All articles use TOML format (`+++`). The front matter cannot be removed; it contains metadata Hugo needs (title, date, author, etc.). We can convert from TOML (`+++`) to YAML (`---`) if you prefer.

**Summary:**
- `+++` is TOML front matter (required metadata)
- Cannot be removed (Hugo needs it)
- Can be converted to YAML (`---`) if preferred

Would you like me to:
1. Convert all articles from TOML (`+++`) to YAML (`---`)?
2. Leave them as-is?

YAML is more common in Hugo sites, but both work. Which do you prefer?

---
